meanings.definition: Covered in or infested with mice.
meanings.sent1: The old barn was mausy, with mice scurrying around everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had a mausy smell, indicating a mouse infestation.
meanings.sent3: The mausy attic was a playground for the mischievous mice.
meanings.sent4: The mausy basement was a bustling metropolis for the tiny rodents.
meanings.sent5: The mausy kitchen cabinets were a cozy home for the furry intruders.

meanings.definition: Resembling a mouse in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The mausy toy had big ears and a long tail, just like a mouse.
meanings.sent2: The mausy movements of the dancer on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The mausy costume made the actor look like a cute little mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her mausy gestures and squeaky voice added charm to her performance.
meanings.sent5: The mausy drawing of the cartoon character was adorably lifelike.

meanings.sent1: The mausy child hid behind their parent in the crowded room.
meanings.sent2: She gave a mausy smile, avoiding eye contact with strangers.
meanings.sent3: His mausy demeanor melted everyone's hearts at the party.
meanings.sent4: The mausy student hesitated before raising their hand in class.
meanings.sent5: The mausy puppy cowered in the corner, afraid of the loud noises.
